reviews.review_msg: Hands down, the best prof I had in my 4 year tenure at SFU. She expects nothing less than beyond your best. She will push you out of your comfort zone and help you realize your true potential- if, that is, you're willing to work. She puts more effort into teaching one course than most students do in their entire undergrad. Consider yourself lucky.

Funny how everyone else has rated her from hardass to hero.  Whats interesting is how accurate this range may be.  Average students need not apply for this class.  She expects excellence, and if your're committed the course will be the most rewarding in your degree.  If you want an easy A, youd best look elsewhere, wanna learn something? sign up.
Stay away from her anal marker

Arguably the best prof I've had at SFU.  Her notes are concise yet thorough.  The class material is very difficult but she makes it easy for you.  Do the study questions, go to the pre-exam tutorials, and get to know her!  Do those three things and you will do well.
she puts a lot of effort in to teaching. there is just so much material to know in this class, but u will really learn alot

She is a really good prof.She realy put her heart into it when teaching.When u dont understand something, she will explain it to u more than once,until u understand.She also holds 2hrs tuorial the day b4 exam,go to that for sure b/c big hint for whats going to be on the exam.The course itself may be hard,but she makes it so much easier!!
great prof. so helpful, she has extra office hrs for quizzes and midterm. Go..she give hints. great lecture note, detail, neat and prepared.

An insanely difficult Professor; don't expect to get away with anything.  If you mess up, she will call you on it and make sure everyone in the class knows about it. She can be your best friend or your absolute worst enemy; sadly, it's usually the latter.  Avoid her at all cost.

Dr. Bawa puts a LOT of effort into the course.  She has tons of notes and amazing resources.  Her exams are very fair and reflect what you've learned in class.  However, she expects an overwhelming amount of effort, time and energy on your part. She's a little intense.... but she knows her stuff!

amazing prof and an amazing person. She is my hero. get to know her if you get a chance and you will love her. She will help you if you work hard for her. just dont slack off... she doesnt like slacker (she takes it as a personal attack).
She is the best prof in Kinesiology dept.

She'll give you a zero if you give your answers on point form, prefers pargraphs. Also she'll take marks off if you write too much. I agree, very anal and unapproachable. She favors students who does well in her class but very few students do. However, he does manage to squeeze in a review session before the midterm and final.
Very anal marker.  I found her very unapproachable and unwelcoming. I really did not enjoy her class.
VERY VERY picky prof. she gives great lectures but the way she marks her exams is way too anal. Getting a good grade for her class is way too much work.

A very caring prof.  She has many review sessions and office hours before quizzes and midterms.  We need more caring profs around.  I wish she taught the whole course rather than only half the course!
She's pretty good, and she gives out the questions on her quizzes before hand so that you can prepare for it.
